description: Aberdeen boss keen to explore possibility of keeping in-form striker as Celtic anticipate windfall from players elsewhere...
title: Aberdeen to examine permanent deal for Nisbet
title_page: Aberdeen to examine permanent deal for Nisbet - gossip - BBC Sport
maintext:
Aberdeen managerJimmy Thelin is open to a potential move to buy on-loan Kevin Nisbet in the summer, with the Scotland striker having another year to run on his Millwall contract. (Press & Journal - subscription), external
Jeffrey Schlupp says he is "loving it" on loan at Celtic and is open to signing talks over a permanent deal. (Scottish Sun), external
Celtic are likely to bank nearly Â£10m this summer from the sale of defender Gustaf Lagerbielke, who has impressed on loan at FC Twente, and their sell-on clause for in-demand Jeremie Frimpong, as a host of clubs chase the Bayer Leverkusen wing-back. (Daily Record), external
Neil Lennon laments a "very strange performance" from referee Iain Snedden as his debut as Dunfermline boss ends with defeat at Ayr United, during which he was booked and had new arrival Victor Wanyama sent off. (Glasgow Times), external
